Package task2.model

Interface GameInterface

public interface GameInterface
This interface provides methods for controlling and displaying a game on the command line.


This interface provides methods for pressing virtual "buttons" on the game and retrieving the current game state.

This interface offers four directional buttons, and two action buttons.
They are internally called "up", "down", "left", "right", "a", and "b", but they can be labeled with any other names. These labels are dependent on the implementing class.
The Methods pressUpButton(), pressDownButton(), pressLeftButton(), pressRightButton(), pressAButton(), and pressBButton() are called to indicate the pressing of the buttons, while the methods getUpLabel(), getDownLabel(), getLeftLabel(), getRightLabel(), getALabel(), and getBLabel() are called to retrieve the labels of the buttons.


The following conditions are to be met by any class that implements this interface:

A game has to be ready to play when an object implementing this interface is created. No additional initialization is allowed to be required by an implementing class.
A game has to have some sort of ending condition which the player has to be able to trigger, causing the isRunning() method to return false from that point on. A game that has once been ended cannot be restarted.
The getGameState() method should return a string that represents the current state of the game. That string cannot be longer than 40 lines, each line not exceeding 80 characters.

    • pressUpButton

      void pressUpButton()
      Indicates pressing up button. Doesn't do anything if isRunning() is returning false.

      Indicates pressing down button. Doesn't do anything if isRunning() is returning false.

    • getGameState

      String getGameState()
      Returns a string that represents the current state of the game. Contains no more than 40 lines, each line not exceeding 80 characters. Commonly includes the state of the game playing field if applicable to the game.model This method returns the entire game state, not just the playing field.
      Returns:
      a string that represents the current state of the game

      Returns true if the game is still running.
      Returns:
      true if the game is still running
